page.title: 03The Church Part 1
page.content: Our church,{St Mary, Auchterhouse,}was built in the 13th century. The parish is almost unique in that the site of the present church is the only centre of religion within the parish since the coming of{Christianity}to Scotland in the 9th century. Prior to that there were two places in the parish believed to have been{Druid {Circles.}After the Reformation the church, built in the days of{Bishop {Galfridus}of{Dunkeld}in the 13th century, was virtually destroyed. It was rebuilt in 1775 but the old{ {Gothic}church, apart from the bell tower, had disappeared and been replaced by the clean classical structure that we see today. The altar that had stood in the east end of the{ {Gothic}church was now replaced by the pulpit on the south side of the present one.
